body: Ibrahim Diarra posted pictures of a mosque in Yopougon, Côte d'Ivoire which he says was vandalised on February 26 by President Laurent Gbagbo's Young Patriots. The photos appeared on the Facebook page, Pour la paix, rien que la paix en Côte d'Ivoire ("For peace, nothing but peace"). Côte d'Ivoire has seen protests and violence for the 10 last days. The United Nations said they fear a civil war could reignite.
original_body: Ibrahim Diarra posted pictures of a mosque in Yopougon, Côte d'Ivoire which he says was vandalised on February 26 by President Laurent Gbagbo's Young Patriots. The photos appeared on the Facebook page, Pour la paix, rien que la paix en Côte d'Ivoire ("For peace, nothing but peace"). Côte d'Ivoire has seen protests and violence for the 10 last days. The United Nations said they fear a civil war could reignite.
title: Côte d'Ivoire: Images of Vandalised Mosque in Yopougon
